content:
The East Midlands RCO Events http://www2.le.ac.uk daily 1 2006-02-14T08:00:00Z Bringing GMES and regions closer http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/g-step/doris-net/events/2012/copy_of_example-event Bringing GMES and regions closer 08 October 2012, Brussels, Belgium The European network of GMES Regional Contact Offices (RCO) has been set up with the aim of strengthening inter-regional dialogue and raising awareness of GMES at the regional scale met on 8 October 2012 in Brussels, in the Representation office of the State of Baden-W\ufffd\ufffdrttemberg.

Six GMES Regional Contact Offices have been set up and are now operational in the regions of Azores, Basilicata, Bremen, East Midlands, Lombardia, Midi-Pyr\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdes-Aquitaine, each acting  as a link between the potential end-users in each region and the providers of GMES services.

The meeting \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBringing GMES and Regions Closer was attended by around 60 people representing research organisations, local authorities, environmental institutions from the regions as well as the GMES Bureau, DG REGIO, DG Enterprise, Committee of the Regions, EC and EU parliamentary offices.

The event was organized as part of the GMES4Regions initiative (powered by DORIS_Net and GRAAL Coordination Actions which are funded by the Seventh Research Framework Programme), with the support of NEREUS (Network of European Regions Using Space Technologies).

 
]]> No publisher jw285 2012-12-17T12:36:36Z News Item Satellite Data Apps: Funding and Protecting Your Innovation http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/g-step/doris-net/events/2012/copy2_of_example-event Thursday 18th October 2012, The National Space Centre Could you use free satellite and other Earth Observation data to increase business potential? If you have a customer data set and a product, you could have a novel \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdApp\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd  waiting for development.

G-STEP\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds FREE innovation event will cover sources and uses of map and location based data and how you could collaborate with data experts to develop fund and protect your innovation.

Hewlett-Packard - Bob McEwan (KEYNOTE SPEAKER)

Catherine Mealing-Jones (Director Growth, Applications & EU Programmes) - UK Space Agency

Ian Holt (Developer Programme Manager) - Ordnance Survey

British Geological Survey - confirming speaker

European Space Agency - confirming speaker - Data Sources and uses

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-Break\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-

Dr Alexis Comber - University of Leicester

Professor Paul Monks - G-STEP (University of Leciester)

Dr Eric Goodyer - De Montfort University

Keith Geary - G2Way

Mark Iliffe - Taarifa


\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-Lunch\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-


Session 2 (afternoon) Funding and Protecting your Innovation:

Robert Lowson - FP7 Space NCP

Tim Just - Technology Stategy Board

European Space Agency - confirming speaker - IAP Funding Programmes

David Bradshaw (Taxation Partner) - Dains LLP

Oliver Pooley (Patent Advisor) - Swindell & Pearson Ltd


Expert advice on:

- Funding opportunities in a tough economic climate
- How to create a successful consortia
- How to capitalise on your idea: Tax and IP
- Success stories


Exhibition open throughout the day.
Exhibition Space Available (Free but limited)
